verse:
यथा नद्यः स्यन्दमानाः समुद्रेऽस्तं गच्छन्ति नामरूपे विहाय।
तथा विद्वान्‌ नामरूपाद् विमुक्तः परात्परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम्‌ ॥
meaning: Meaning:Just as rivers flow and merge into the ocean, abandoning their names and forms, similarly the wise person, liberated from the limitations of name and form, attains the supreme divine reality. This verse highlights the idea that like rivers merging into the ocean, individuals can transcend their limited identities and merge into the ultimate reality, attaining a divine state of existence.
